thread.title: Trump, the brash New Yorker, picks up Southern campaign
thread.title_full: Trump, the brash New Yorker, picks up Southern campaign

title: Trump, the brash New Yorker, picks up Southern campaign
text:
Updated: 3:21 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 | Posted: 3:21 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 Trump, the brash New Yorker, picks up Southern campaign Related View Larger In this Oct. 8, 2015, photo Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump speaks at a rally in Las Vegas. Trump is expanding his paid campaign staff into several Southern states that will be key to selecting the Republican presidential nominee. Trump’s advisers say it’s a sign he’s committed to a long race, despite suggestions he’s reconsidering his bid. (AP Photo/John Locher) By BILL BARROW The Associated Press ATLANTA — 
Donald Trump is expanding his paid campaign staff into several Southern states that will be key to selecting the Republican presidential nominee. 
Trump's advisers say it's a sign he's committed to a long race, despite suggestions he's reconsidering his bid. 
He now has paid staff in South Carolina, Alabama, Georgia, Florida, Tennessee, Texas and Virginia. 
Trump will be in metro Atlanta for a rally Saturday that is expected to draw thousands. He set the high mark for Republicans this campaign when he drew about 30,000 to an Alabama rally in August. 
Political observers say Trump may not seem like a natural fit for Southerners. But the South has long been the nation's most conservative region and most distrustful of central government. That makes Trump's anti-Washington pitch easy to sell. Copyright The Associated Press
